result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Aarstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Continue with current therapy.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- DNA sample, pay surcharge. Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA expungd if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher D Aarstad in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Christopher D Aarstad in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Continue with current therapy.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample, pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing memo from the defense received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Christopher D Aarstad in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pre-trial conference. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Case is adjourned for sentencing. No-violent contact order continues. Court ordered the jury trial date of 9/2/15 vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher D Aarstad NOT in court. Attorney Daniel C Adams NOT in court, appearances waived. Dax Odom for William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled. The state has verified the content of the affidavit and took no position regarding the defense request. Court GRANTED the no violent contact order. Court Vacated Bail Hearing on 7/10/2015.

Court reviewed motion and affidavit filed by defense in branch 40. Arguments from the state and defense. Court denied defense motion to modify no contact order and set matter for a hearing on the no contact order before branch 40. If state is able to contact the victim to verify affidavit court advised parties the court would recall the matter and modify the no contact order.

Defendant Christopher D Aarstad in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40.
Parties previously selected Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates with Deputy Court Clerk in Br. 40 off the record. Matter set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
of Brittany Newman received and filed.  rmm
for Modification of Conditions of Bail received and filed.  rmm
No Firearms Order signed and filed.
The remaining bail is to be returned to the remitter.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brittany N.

Defendant Christopher D Aarstad in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/10/15 @ 1:30pm
